definition: (increased) passenger transportation around Chinese New Year

sentences.chinese: 春運於一月三十日正式開始。

sentences.english: Beijing West Station is expecting 5.6 million passengers during this Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 北京西站預計春運期間將有560萬乘客。

sentences.english: It's still uncertain whether the College Spring Sports will be held this year.
sentences.chinese: 學院今年的春運會是否開還是個未知數。

sentences.english: It is forbidden to bring fireworks on board trains during Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 春運期間，禁止挾帶煙花爆竹上車。

sentences.english: The traffic is very busy during the Spring Festival, especially the train station.
sentences.chinese: 春運期間，交通非常繁忙，尤其是火車站。

sentences.english: With an increasingly affluent middle class chunyun tourism is also on the rise.
sentences.chinese: 隨着中產階級的不斷增加，春運的旅客也在增加。

sentences.english: The station began to sell the first batch of train tickets for the Spring Festival travel period on the day.
sentences.chinese: 該火車站當天開始出售春運期間的第一批火車票。

sentences.english: Biologist Kon Lorenze doesn't have sample of transportation during spring festival period at hand when conducting such research.
sentences.chinese: 洛倫次在做這樣的研究時，手中沒有中國春運的樣本。

sentences.english: According to take in, this time"iron eagle" proceeding will had been sustaining till spring to run end.
sentences.chinese: 據瞭解，此次“鐵鷹”行動將一直持續到春運結束。

sentences.english: The tribulation of Chinese migrant workers is no better revealed than in the Spring Festival Travel.
sentences.chinese: 中國農民工的所有苦難，都集中體現在春運中。

sentences.english: Fourthly, stick to the information report system for transportation during Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 四是嚴格春運信息報送制度。

definition: to return to one's home town
